commit_message:
Add the rebinding chance in _bind_port_if_needed

Make function _bind_port_if_needed to bind at least one time when the port's
binding status passed in is already in binding_failed.

Change-Id: I823ff5ca66833cdca459f13ab28f5075ae03ded3
Closes-Bug: #1399249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/141044/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # will try to rebind at least one time if vif_type is # binding_failed when passed in. if not (count == 0 and binding.vif_type == portbindings.VIF_TYPE_BINDING_FAILED): # We either don't need to bind the port, or can't, so # notify if needed and return. if allow_notify and need_notify: self._notify_port_updated(context) return context
deleted_lines: # We either don't need to bind the port, or can't, so # notify if needed and return. if allow_notify and need_notify: self._notify_port_updated(context) return context

commit_message:
Remove CONF reference from volume client

To move volume client to tempest-lib, this patch moves
CONF.volume.volume_size to the client setting.

commit_message:
Rename data_processing client

The client module name of data_processing was just 'client', but
the other service clients contain their service names.
So the one of data_processing was different and inconsistent.
This patch renames the module name to data_processing_client.

Change-Id: Iefd04a5e22ea3943ef368fb8d27a0a4a28a75f8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/155633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add vcpu_model to instance object

The vcpu_model gives the vcpu information for an instance like the
features, the cpu model and is saved as extra for the instance object.

Implements: blueprint resource-objects
Change-Id: I0a50dcd47899b15b2bea01c782109ec57ee88bfc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/89/153689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'vcpu_model': None, columns = ['numa_topology', 'pci_requests', 'flavor', 'vcpu_model']

commit_message:
Sync with oslo-incubator

Changes include:
ac17de9 Use oslo_utils instead of deprecated oslo.utils...
1c1bf07 Report: Add basic processes section...
2aacb11 Change oslo.config to oslo_config...
2fbf506 Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API...
2fbf506 Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API...
fbd77a7 Allow overriding name for periodic tasks...
9896e0e Separate add_periodic_task from the metaclass __init__...
809080e Introduce fileutils ensure_dir creation mode parameter...

NOTE: the process support in Reports adds a new dependency on psutil

Change-Id: Iebb8aa4b404e755c03eaf466c7acc8b5ffab5bcd

commit_message:
Support per Driver Sensor Meters

Implements: blueprint support-per-driver-sensor-meters

Change-Id: I57e8059e035475e74a85dc676b40f7fd46f01398
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/74/130074/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Support per driver sensor meters ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/support-per-driver-sensor-meters This blueprint is for changing the ironic conductor _send_sensor_data interface implementation to support sending sensor metrics from providers other than IPMI to Ceilometer. Problem description =================== The current implementation of _send_sensor_data is IPMI specific in a number of ways. The conductor will only get sensors from a node which is deployed (has an instance_uuid) and the notifications sent by the conductor to Ceilometer go to an IPMI specific Ceilometer plugin via event type hardware.ipmi.metrics. I would like to be able to return health (and potentially other) sensor information from an iLO Management driver by implementing an iLO specific driver.management.get_sensors_data() interface. The sensor information returned by the iLO Management driver should not be treated as IPMI sensors. Also, health information about a platform should be available even if the node has not yet been deployed with software. Proposed change =============== The ironic conductor _send_sensor_data routine should always call the underlying driver.management.get_sensors_data routine at each poll interval. It should be the responsibility of the underlying management get_sensors_data routine to determine if it is appropriate to gather sensor information for the node that it manages. If a driver determines it is not appropriate to gather sensor information for a node, the driver should simply return an empty sensor list. The conductor should not need to interpret who the sensor provider is in order to send the sensor information along to the metering system. I see the conductors role in sensor metering as follows: * Call Management Driver to read sensors at a specifiable interval * Create per meter naming using the information provided in the sensors returned by the Management Driver. This will ensure consistent meter naming across multiple providers. It will also enable consistent meter naming for other metering systems (like Monasca) in the future. * Make sure that sensors sent to the metering system are accessible by consumers using the ironic node UUID as a search key. With the current implementation, per meter naming is not the responsibility of the conductor, but the responsibility of the metering system plugin. As part of this proposed change, I would also like to see the metering system sensor plugin be generic so that no changes to the metering system notification plugin will be required to support new sensor types. In order to create a generic metering system plugin will require that sensor metrics sent to the plugin be self describing with sufficient information for the metering system plugin to create the samples per sensor meter without performing any sensor data transformations. Today, addition of new sensor types require changes to the Ceilometer plugin as well as the Ceilometer setup.cfg file. There is a field added by Ceilometer to each sensors meter resource_metadata called 'node' which contains the ironic node UUID. This field was added to enable ironic node UUID searching in Juno. The 'node' field will carried forward in the resource_metadata to provide for backward compatibility with regard to searching for sensors associated with a specific ironic node UUID. The 'node' field will be added to each sensor record by the ironic conductor. In order to support these Conductor changes, a new notification plugin will be needed and the naming for sensors n ceilometer will need to be changed. The following blueprint will be used to track these modifications * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/generic-notification-sensor-meter-plugin Alternatives ------------ An additional plugin could be created for each sensor provider, but this would require quite a bit of code duplication. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- In order to support provider independent sensor naming has resulted in a decision to change the Ceilometer meter names for sensors in a way which will not be fully backward compatible with the sensor naming in the Juno release. Here is an example of Ceilometer meter names for sensors in Juno. :: | Name | Resource ID | hardware.ipmi.current | IronicNodeUUID-power_meter_(0x16) | hardware.ipmi.temperature| IronicNodeUUID-16-system_board_(0x15) What is being proposed is to drop the ipmi string from the name altogether and append the IPMI 'Sensor ID' to the Ceilometer meter name instead of appending it to the Resource ID. Also, removal of the IPMI record ID from the standard Sensor ID is also necessary. So, transforming the above to the new naming would result in the following Ceilometer sensor naming: :: | Name | Resource ID | hardware.current.power_meter | IronicNodeUUID | hardware.temperature.system_board | IronicNodeUUID The work required outside the conductor to implement thse sensor naming changes are covered in the following two blueprints. * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/change-ipmi-sensor-id-name * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/generic-notification-sensor-meter-plugin As long as a consumer doesn't parse the Ceilometer names or resource IDs for sensors, backward compatibility should be maintained. With the new naming scheme, prior sensors already in the Ceilometer database will retain their prior naming, so upgrading to the new conductor and Ceilometer plugin will cause a loss in continuity in sensor naming if the sensor consumer parses or uses names for API lookup. Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ Acquisition of all the sensors for a given IronicNodeUUID should be faster once the IronicNodeUUID is used as the Resource ID. With the current implementation, every sensor has to be searched to find a 'node' field which matches a specified IronicNodeUUID. Other deployer impact --------------------- Changing the conductor to send notifkication messages to a new generic sensor Ceilometer plugin will require updating Ceilometer in conjunction with the conductor if Ironic to Ceilometer sensor metering is being used. Developer impact ---------------- There will a conductor dependency on a new generic Ceilometer plugin in order for sensor metering to occur. Developer coordination of changes to Ceilometer and the Ironic conductor will be necessary. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <jmank@hp.com> Other contributors: <None> Work Items ---------- * Change the conductor to remove all IPMI related assumptions. * Change the get_node_info_list query to not filter based on associated being true and move instance_uuid check into the ipmitool and ipminative drivers. * Create a SensorMetrics base class and CeilommeterSensorMetrics derived class for meter name creation, sensor packaging and sensor posting. The Conductor will be modified to instantiate a CeilometerSensorMetrics class at initialization and invoke its methods in the Conductor _send_sensor_data periodic timer routine. The intent of the SensorMetrics class is to encapsulate any sensor data transformations necesary for the targeted metering system. :: @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class SensorMetrics(object): @abc.abstractmethod def get_meter_name(self, sensor_type, sensor_id): """ : param sensor_type: Type of Sensor, i.e. Temperature, Fan,... : param sensor_id: 'Sensor ID' is the unique textual name for the sensor """ @abc.abstractmethod def package_sensors(self, node_uuid, data): """ : param node_uuid: Ironic Node UUID : param data: Driver reported Sensor data dictionary Package the Driver Sensor Data into a list format adding the following dictionary fields: 'node' - node_uuid 'sensor_name' - Name of the sensor in the meter system see get_meter_name() above The following are generated by parsing the 'Sensor Reading' 'sensor_reading' - Sensor Reading Value 'sensor_unit' - Type of Sensor reading Units If the 'Sensor Reading' cannot be parsed successfully, the sensor will not be added to the list. The 'Sensor Reading' field is not sent to the metering system. """ @abc.abstractmethod def send_sensors(self, context, node_uuid, instance_uuid, sensors): """ : param context: : param node_uuid: Ironic Node UUID : param instance_uuid: Running instance UUID or None if not deployed : param sensors: List of Sensors to send to metrics system """ Dependencies ============ This work is dependent on the following ironic blueprint and specification. * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/send-ilo-health-metrics-to-ceilometer * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127378 * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/change-ipmi-sensor-id-name It is also dependent on the following Ceilometer blueprint and specification TBD specification. * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/generic-notification-sensor-meter-plugin Testing ======= Unit tests will be need to be added to verify the new code paths. I plan on doing Proliant platform testing of the capabilities as well. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== These Conductor changes will require associated driver changes and Ceilometer plugin changes. Documentation Impact ==================== I don't know of any specific documentation changes specifically necessary for updating the conductor. Documentation changes to docs/source/deploy/install-guide.rst outlined in the send-ilo-health-metrics-to-ceilometer spec should be sufficient: See Dependencies above. References ========== * [openstack-dev] [Ironic][Ceilometer] Proposed Change to Sensor meter naming in Ceilometer http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-October/048631.html

commit_message:
Write share_helpers to config as CSV

Currently, the share_helpers parameter is implemented
in the manifest as a list, but the list is written
directly to the config file.  It needs to be written
as a comma-separated list instead.

Change-Id: Ic57c4e78567712397aff9550036f8feb772ad4d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/36/137536/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $share_helpers = 'CIFS=manila.share.drivers.generic.CIFSHelper NFS=manila.share.drivers.generic.NFSHelper',

objects: fix numa obj relationships

The attributes used in obj_relationships for mempages
and cells are not correctly set. This commit fix the
errors.

Related-Bug: #1417201

commit_message:
Remove old deprecated xstatic angular packages

Xstatic-Angular 1.3.7 includes the following packages:

XStatic-Angular-Cookies
XStatic-Angular-Mock

They can now be removed.  This had to be done
in a multi-step process because of the interdependency chain,
being blocked by integration checks (horizon has dependency)
on these packages.

1) The newer pakage has to be added to global requirements
2) a) The new dependency has to be added to Horizon
   b) Old dependencies must be removed from Horizon
3) The older packages must be removed from global requirements

At least this is the best way that I can tell how to make it all
work since I can't modify the requirements across projects
in the same patch set.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: Ib5b1d03922af8a8419a690f84d9b639bbecb10a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/96/145096/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make identity id mapping handle unicode

Identity id mapping is used to create public ids for local entities,
typically stored in LDAP backends. Part of the mapping involves
creating a hash of the local identifiers - but this hashing did
not correctly handle unicode. This patch fixes this.

(cherry picked from commit Icc2a6bc4a7e88004bbe6f86d3a96cff07be4c6f9)
Closes-Bug: 1419187

Change-Id: I308bae4f2743d573c57c34af808e16ce9bbd27f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/82/155282/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: m.update(mapping[key].encode('utf-8'))

commit_message:
Add description of --control_location

Adds a description of the --control_location
option for use with the cinder encryption-type-create command.

Change-Id: I8a818acd9c7ef97ae6e0fe03ec5739965a82aedc
Closes-bug: #1412180

commit_message:
Improve testing of unicode id mapping

We currently don't test that our id mapping correctly supports
unicode - and in fact, it doesn't. This patch adds a test that
demonstrates this. A follow-on patch will fix the issue.

(cherry picked from commit Ief0597bbd0f1486f23eb799b68a85b590b7e35ef)
Partial-Bug: 1419187

Change-Id: I6b0b3ea1068e8839a974ad205e5059e5be7ac7b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/79/155279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- def test_id_mapping_handles_unicode(self): local_id = u'fk1' local_entity = {'domain_id': self.domainA['id'], 'local_id': local_id, 'entity_type': mapping.EntityType.USER} # Check no mappings for the new local entity self.assertIsNone(self.id_mapping_api.get_public_id(local_entity)) # The mapping generator should handle unicode, although currently this # fails due to bug #1419187 self.assertRaises(UnicodeEncodeError, self.id_mapping_api.create_id_mapping, local_entity)

commit_message:
Fix race on default role creation

In add_user_to_project() it checks if the default role exists before
trying to add the role to the user and project. If it doesn't exist it
will attempt to create the role. However if 2 requests happen at
roughly the same time the 2 role creations will race causing one to
fail with a conflict error. This patch addresses this issue by catching
the conflict exception and treating it as the create succeeded (which it
did just elsewhere)

Conflicts:
	keystone/assignment/core.py

Change-Id: Iab95ed8b3913c020eafa919231d764ba8b780571
Closes-Bug: #1419043
(cherry picked from commit 0b1027886ae6bc29abd86aa8ede499be5f5fc2ae)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/21/153721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: self.driver.create_role(config.CONF.member_role_id, role) except exception.Conflict: LOG.info(_LI("Creating the default role %s failed because it " "was already created"), config.CONF.member_role_id) # now that default role exists, the add should succeed
deleted_lines: self.driver.create_role(config.CONF.member_role_id, role) #now that default role exists, the add should succeed

commit_message:
Access migration fields like an object in finish_revert_resize

The migration parameter is a nova object so access the fields using dot
notation rather than like a primitive dict.

The tests were already using objects so this is a simple cleanup.

Change-Id: I4999f4e067434806fb6a9dc59c8c0f696475d806

commit_message:
Ensure designate user/group exist

Without the ensure line, Puppet will only try to manage the attributes
on these resources.  This issue only occurs if the system packages don't
create the users.

Change-Id: Id46f06a03c31c1dd29971fec21703715744ab8d5

commit_message:
Add in python-openstacksdk to requirements.txt

The python-openstacksdk has matured enough to integrate it into a few
projects.  I currently working on a couple proof of concepts for its
use.

* The library is activily maintained and supported by a fairly
  large community.
  https://github.com/stackforge/python-openstacksdk/graphs/contributors
* The library is good code.  We have extensive tests and examples and
  there was a proof of concept with the python-openstackclient in the
  past.
* The library is python 3 compatible, gates test this regularly.
* The library has an Apache license.
* The library is *not* packaged in any distros.
* There is no other library that is intended to be the one SDK for
  all the OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Iaa3815e8ee11f72b90ab1180dcb4a70f4866614f

commit_message:
Releases locks in tests

This releases lock in tests when possible, to cleanup the ipc semaphore
entry used by the ipc driver.

Change-Id: Ic8be9f32cd3660e54ee1990f00fc3f1277056c9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/15/155715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lock2.release()

commit_message:
libvirt: utils canonicalize now the image architecture property

If the image has an architecture property, the libvirt utils did *not*
canonicalize that. The architecture switches in the libvirt driver
could then produce a wrong domain xml.
This patch canonicalizes the image architecture property.

Closes-Bug: 1418675

Change-Id: Ie88c8e79f6b31f48ad0e98215bd7f6dbca93119a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/154804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return arch.canonicalize(image_arch)

commit_message:
libvirt: memnodes shuold be set to a list instead of None

Currently, _get_guest_numa_tune_memnodes returns None,
when an installed version of Libvirt doesn't support a
memnode element in the numa tune configuration,
while it should always return a list.

Related-Bug: #1415333

Change-Id: I28a5a2c65aa703b0161ebca8659dc96a7b6c1bf6

commit_message:
Make compute use objects usage 'best practice'

commit 6c32576b move objects definition into object folder directly,
all other modules do not need to import other objects modules.

Change-Id: I72c0a447d4f3e75ca32ac037d961f001a1eb4d31

commit_message:
Split templates and tests in scenario tests

- Added subdirectory "templates" for storing all templates used in
  scenario tests.
- Added parameter sub_dir for method _load_template.
- Inline template was moved in templates directory from
  test_neutron_autoscaling.

Change-Id: I1acaf1ccc1466cf7ffc2e004eff486f49f4b5928
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/80/155680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support for local boot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-09 19:47:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/14693054c8523fa7c3218d4fa6085caf463056d2', 'message': 'Add support for local boot (PoC)

Proof of concept.

Change-Id: Ide08e2b41dcf74c69dfbce242112da701fa15187
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 18:19:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/a10195339599991c0800139f5cc3f03ec3a6065d', 'message': "Add support for local boot

This patch implements the part that reads the specified boot_option in
the node.instance_info['capabilities'] that have been passed to Ironic by
the Nova Ironic Driver and pass that information to the deploy ramdisk
by adding it to the kernel cmdline in the PXE configuration file that
will be generated to that node.

This patch only apply to the pxe_* drivers, because the blueprint is
about adding local boot support for deployments that uses partition
images. The agent driver right now supports full disk images only.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: Ide08e2b41dcf74c69dfbce242112da701fa15187
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-27 18:21:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/f038d103df3124d71bab7b92cbdc6930b07deb78', 'message': "Add support for local boot

This patch implements the part that reads the specified boot_option in
the node.instance_info['capabilities'] that have been passed to Ironic by
the Nova Ironic Driver and pass that information to the deploy ramdisk
by adding it to the kernel cmdline in the PXE configuration file that
will be generated to that node.

This patch also makes sure that we clean the PXE configuration files for
the node marked to local boot after it's deployed, so that any attempt
to boot it from the network will not work.

This patch only apply to the pxe_* drivers, because the blueprint is
about adding local boot support for deployments that uses partition
images. The agent driver right now supports full disk images only.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: Ide08e2b41dcf74c69dfbce242112da701fa15187

commit_message:
Add support for local boot

This patch implements the part that reads the specified boot_option in
the node.instance_info['capabilities'] that have been passed to Ironic by
the Nova Ironic Driver and pass that information to the deploy ramdisk
by adding it to the kernel cmdline in the PXE configuration file that
will be generated to that node.

This patch also makes sure that we clean the PXE configuration files for
the node marked to local boot after it's deployed, so that any attempt
to boot it from the network will not work.

This patch only apply to the pxe_* drivers, because the blueprint is
about adding local boot support for deployments that uses partition
images. The agent driver right now supports full disk images only.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: Ide08e2b41dcf74c69dfbce242112da701fa15187

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Adds instance missing metrics enabling

Adds the enabling of the 'Aggregated Average Memory Utilization'
metrics for each instance and updates unit test to make sure it
is enabled.

This commit is needed in order for the Hyper-V ceilometer compute
agent to report the instance average memory utilization metrics.

Change-Id: If24294c4d2a325d76fbb01d675cc4c34bfc2e5fb

commit_message:
Add ipv6 support to fake network models

Currently, the functions in fake_network_cache_model all default to
building a fake ipv4 network, and so the easiest way to test against a
fake ipv6 network is to manually create ipv6 components (subnets,
routes, ips) and plug them into the default fake VIF. This makes testing
ipv6 functionality rather error-prone and laborious.

This patch adds an option to create ipv6 models.

Change-Id: I9aacbc45ce79cab05c6611d38fc2daaf2ba5dab7
Co-Authored-By: Ellen Hui <ellenfkh@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1336094

commit_message:
Add PCI Passthrough/SR-IOV support

The main issue with INI files, it doesn't support complex structures
which end up being declared as strings. This approach get that chain of
character and verify it's a valid JSON equivalent before assigning the
value.

Another driver is even though Hiera supports complex structure, we tend
to keep it simple when using Hiera interpolations.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SR-IOV-Passthrough-For-Networking#SR-IOV_Configuration

Change-Id: I27d43af13fcc80f41a16c31a0a6cfe112dc96acb
(cherry picked from commit c671ad7d2544e4e6fb54f10d917d2137618a2869)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/16/154616/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'json' def array_of_hash?(list) return false unless !list.empty? && list.class == Array list.each do |e| return false unless e.class == Hash end true end module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:check_array_of_hash, :arity =>1, :type => :rvalue, :doc => "Check input String is a valid Array of Hash in JSON style") do |arg| if arg[0].class == String begin list = JSON.load(arg[0].gsub("'","\"")) rescue JSON::ParserError raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{arg[0]} is invalid" else return arg[0] if array_of_hash?(list) end else raise Puppet::ParseError, "Syntax error: #{arg[0]} is not a String" end return '' end end

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-07 13:52:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ed1dc22249be91a85e8e41d5e2e5c1dab42a745c', 'message': 'Fixes interfaces template identification issue

the interfaces template is injected in the associated instances or

The template includes the interface name, based on a progressive numbering

identify the interfaces in the guest OS if the actual interface naming

commit_message:
Fixes interfaces template identification issue

When using networks without DHCP enabled and "flat_injected" set to True,
the interfaces template is injected in the associated instances or
included in the config drive metadata.

The template includes the interface name, based on a progressive numbering
(eth0, eth1, etc). In case of multiple nics, there's no clear way to
identify the interfaces in the guest OS if the actual interface naming
differs, this is especially valid for Windows instances.

Since the MAC address (hardware address) assigned to each vNIC identifies
uniquely the interface, providing the mac address during the template
generation solves the issue.

Change-Id: Id82db6d83caedf0e95f882d909b77ea9b98b2547
Closes-Bug: #1400080

commit_message:
Add Ironic support into nova puppet modules

Ironic needs to make some additions to the nova config
file in order to run.  The remaining configuraitons will
be added to the nova plugin in packstack.

Change-Id: I34c7c8a6001b0433aee9017ac571e3bd4f2f02b2

NUMACell object is intended to be converted in a primitive before to
be stored into the database. The object framework provides a way to
track modified fields which make easy the way update data in the
historical style but not necessary in the case of NUMACell.

The constructor of NUMACell has been overrided to set default values
of the fields 'pinned_cpus' and 'siblings' which make the object
to record these fields as changed which is something we do not want and make confusing when debugging

commit_message:
objects: remove default values for numa cell

The default values was introduced to avoid the necessity
to update all tests when new fields was added.
This commit clean tests and remove the default values of the
object.

Change-Id: Ia22d91925912ff9572f543109e4d7bf89190ec0e

commit_message:
Persisting dependency graph & resource versioning.

Persisting dependency task graphs and versioning of resources is
fundamental need for convergence. This spec covers these two aspects.

This spec is subsidiary of Convergence Specification.
Convergence Specification: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95907/7

Change-Id: I09710d6fd06b9249a7ce112fa1aabdf810f38380
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/49/123749/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Convergence ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence Problem description =================== In memory dependency graph --------------------------- To distribute the processing of a stack and to make the processing fault-tolerant, the dependency task graph must be persisted. As of now the graph is in memory and if the engine crashes, the stack is is lost. Persisted graph will enable any engine to take the stack operation and proceed. Backup stack ------------- Backup stack is needed to keep track of resources being replaced during update and resources marked as "dirty" for deletion later when the update transaction is over. Backup stack is also used to roll-back. Disadvantages of backup stack ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Ideally, there should be only one graph, which can persisted in DB, and Heat engines can pick up tasks from that graph. With backup stack, Heat engine has to traverse two graphs to serve the requests. With convergence, when we allow concurrent stack operations, Heat engines should only see one stack (and hence one graph) to operate on. Backup stack restricts us from doing that. * There are cross dependencies between resources from the stack and it's backup. To process the request an engine has to traverse both the graphs. In case of failure while roll-backs, some of the dependencies are lost. Please refer to this e-mail_ where Zane points out the drawbacks. .. _e-mail: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/046874.html Proposed change =============== Stack task dependency graph must be parsed and persisted in DB. Heat should no longer use back-up stack and version the resources to track them. Versioning of resources will help us identify the resources to be rolled-back or deleted in case update-replace fails for them. There should be only one stack in DB for each user-defined stack at any point of time. In case of updates, the templates and environment must be backed-up during update to facilitate roll-back. The parameters column should be moved from stack table to raw_template table. With resource versioning there could more than one resource with same name in DB for a stack, resource name can no longer be used as key. As of now, the dependency graph has resource name as key. Resource ID should be used as key when a graph is created for a new request and persisted in DB. To facilitate graph creation with resource Id, resources will be persisted in DB first and then the graph will be generated and updated in DB. Data model changes ------------------ 1. resource_graph table (new table) a. resource_id varchar(36): NOT NULL foreign key to resource table. b. needed_by varchar(36): foreign key to resource table. c. stack_id varchar(36): NOT NULL foreign key to stack table. d. retry_count int(11): Default is 0 e. observed_ready boolean: True indicates resource converged. 2. raw_template table Add columns: a. predecessor int(11): Previous template to roll back to. b. environment longtext: The environment applicable to this template. 3. stack table Remove columns: a. Remove parameters column. This is moved to environment column in raw_template table. 4. resource table Add column: a. version int(11): Record the version of resource.

commit_message:
Convergence: Changes to remove backup stack.

This changes work for stack create/update/delete for nova server and
RandomString. Not tested with other resoruces.

Change-Id: Ic7c7dba146ea1ea2f61084eb087b086d555b1f1c

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sqlalchemy def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = sqlalchemy.MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine resource = sqlalchemy.Table('resource', meta, autoload=True) rsrc_defn = sqlalchemy.Column('rsrc_defn', sqlalchemy.UnicodeText()) rsrc_defn_hash = sqlalchemy.Column('rsrc_defn_hash', sqlalchemy.String(40)) rsrc_defn.create(resource) rsrc_defn_hash.create(resource) def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta = sqlalchemy.MetaData(bind=migrate_engine) table = sqlalchemy.Table('resource', meta, autoload=True) table.c.rsrc_defn.drop() table.c.rsrc_defn_hash.drop()

commit_message:
Run noop testing via rake spec

WORK IN PROGRESS

We can run noop tests via 'rake spec'. This will allow us to:

  - Make sure that catalog compiles and there are no dependency
    cycles in the graph.
  - Use RSpec tests to check that needed puppet resources present
    in the catalog for specific astute.yaml configuration.

In order to test just execute these commands:
  export WORKSPACE=/tmp/fuel_noop_tests
  mkdir -p $WORKSPACE
  ./utils/jenkins/fuel_noop_tests.sh

Related-bug: #1402738
Implement blueprint deployment-dryrun

Fuel CI temporarily disabled since this change does not affect
MOS deplyoment process, only CI itself.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I5a3b569e86d8838d5c20b590cc6cc106fb2242a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/22/141022/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppetlabs_spec_helper/module_spec_helper' require 'rspec-puppet' RSpec.configure do |c| c.module_path = File.expand_path(File.join(__FILE__, '..', '..', '..', '..', 'deployment', 'puppet')) c.manifest = File.expand_path(File.join(__FILE__, '..', '..', '..', '..', 'deployment', 'puppet', 'osnailyfacter', 'examples', 'site.pp')) c.before :each do Facter::Util::Loader.any_instance.stubs(:load_all) Facter.clear Facter.clear_messages end end

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 16:48:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/docker/templates/functions.sh.erb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/f4c92f292646034381a11366274d0c8b5624b72b', 'message': "Partially fixes behavior of dockerctl to omit deleting iptables' rules
occasionally.

Change-Id: Idbfa53f3282d5fd01c461519eb577e5dc7e64379
Closes-Bug: #1395836
"}]
commit_message:
Partially fixes behavior of dockerctl to omit deleting iptables' rules
occasionally.

Change-Id: Idbfa53f3282d5fd01c461519eb577e5dc7e64379
Closes-Bug: #1395836
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/03/155403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: done < <(iptables-save | grep -- "-m $proto --dport $port ")

commit_message:
Adds tests create/update port with multiple attributes

* Adds test for creating port with multiple ip addresses
* Adds test for create/update port with multiple attributes
  (name, sec_grp, admin_state_up, fixed_ips)

Co-Authored-By: Neeti Dahiya <ndahiya@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rohan Kanade <rkanade@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1396639

added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_port_with_multiple_ip(self): # Create a network with two subnets network = self.create_network() subnet_1 = self.create_subnet(network) subnet_2 = self.create_subnet(network) fixed_ip_1 = [{'subnet_id': subnet_1['id']}] fixed_ip_2 = [{'subnet_id': subnet_2['id']}] fixed_ips = fixed_ip_1 + fixed_ip_2 # Create a port with two IP addresses port = self.create_port(network, fixed_ips=fixed_ips) self.assertEqual(2, len(port['fixed_ips']))

commit_message:
Add update + add/delete resource cases

The patch defines the following complex cases for
create-update-delete stack scenario in rally tests for Heat:
Case 1:
- Heat creates a stack
- Heat updates the stack (stack resource is updating
and children resource is creating during stack-update)
- Heat deletes the stack
Case 2:
- Heat creates a stack
- Heat updates the stack (stack resource is updating and children
resource is deleting during stack-update)
- Heat deletes the stack

Change-Id: I9d420b316ce38fd73f8eb74c0be253ed1a20f7db

commit_message:
spec: pin rspec-puppet to 1.0.1

rspec-puppet (2.0.0) was released yesterday[1], this new version broke
puppet-openstack unit tests (undefined method `resource')[2] as talked on
and in a second time to update your specs to 2.0.0 and rspec 3.x`)

[1] https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/commit/8459e14807977244c00bdbcf190062c529b63474
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/45/105245/6/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-unit-3.3/3682541/console.html

Change-Id: I6b5ef612b0a0911bb52622c65560afec713d45c0
Partial-bug: #1417604
(cherry picked from commit ad97aa23723ad93886da085e26a712024be79823)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/21/155321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixes unorderered network mappings issue

Replaces normal dict with OrderedDict. This way the order of
the entries from config are kept the same.

Change-Id: I5086cd9deff6102b1912523960f29c36758a42bc
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Fixes-Bug: #142166

commit_message:
Adding new update option to diskimage-create.sh

This change removes the global system updates in favor of only updating
the required packages for diskimage creation. Additionally the script
will not automatically install the updates but will warn the user if the
packages are not installed. A switch is provided to allow the script to
install the updates.

Changes
* adding function to detect an installed package
* adding function to check for a list of installed packages
* adding command line switch for updating (-u)
* removing global update commands
* refactoring update logic to fail gracefully or accept switch
* adding -u switch to build-images gate tool
* adding note in documentation about update command line switch

Closes-Bug: 1375843
Change-Id: Iba5e676fa8ef7a852b71acd9e4c19d32f848285a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/99/151099/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " [-u]" echo " '-u' install missing packages necessary for building"while getopts "p:i:v:dmur:" opt; do u) DIB_UPDATE_REQUESTED=true ;;is_installed() { if [ "$platform" = 'NAME="Ubuntu"' ]; then if dpkg -s "$1" &> /dev/null; then return 0 fi else # centos, fedora, opensuse, or rhel if rpm -q "$1" &> /dev/null; then return 0 fi fi return 1 } need_required_packages() { if [[ "$platform" == 'NAME="Ubuntu"' || "$platform" == 'NAME=Fedora' ]]; then package_list="qemu kpartx git" elif [ "$platform" = 'NAME=openSUSE' ]; then package_list="qemu kpartx git-core" else # centos or rhel package_list="qemu-kvm qemu-img kpartx git" if [ ${platform:0:6} = "CentOS" ]; then # CentOS requires the python-argparse package be installed separately package_list="$package_list python-argparse" fi fi for p in `echo $package_list`; do if ! is_installed $p; then return 0 fi done return 1 } if need_required_packages; then # install required packages if requested if [ -n "$DIB_UPDATE_REQUESTED" ]; then if [ "$platform" = 'NAME="Ubuntu"' ]; then apt-get install $package_list -y elif [ "$platform" = 'NAME=openSUSE' ]; then zypper --non-interactive --gpg-auto-import-keys in $package_list else # fedora, centos, and rhel share an install command if [ ${platform:0:6} = "CentOS" ]; then # install EPEL repo, in order to install argparse sudo rpm -Uvh --force http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/6/x86_64/epel-release-6-8.noarch.rpm fi yum install $package_list -y fi else echo "Missing one of the following packages: $package_list" echo "Please install manually or rerun with the upgrade option (-u)." exit 1
deleted_lines: while getopts "p:i:v:dmr:" opt; doif [ "$platform" = 'NAME="Ubuntu"' ]; then apt-get update -y apt-get install qemu kpartx git -y elif [ "$platform" = 'NAME=Fedora' ]; then yum update -y yum install qemu kpartx git -y elif [ "$platform" = 'NAME=openSUSE' ]; then zypper --non-interactive --gpg-auto-import-keys in kpartx qemu git-core else # centos or rhel yum update -y yum install qemu-kvm qemu-img kpartx git -y if [ ${platform:0:6} = "CentOS" ]; then # install EPEL repo, in order to install argparse sudo rpm -Uvh --force http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/6/x86_64/epel-release-6-8.noarch.rpm # CentOS requires the python-argparse package be installed separately yum install python-argparse -y

commit_message:
Remove unused RPC functions from l3_rpc and agent

This patch depends on "Change-id: #153735". The
patch in the change-id shown above removes the
dependency on the rpc for getting the FloatingIP
Agent Gateway port from the plugin.

Now the RPC function calls can be cleaned up.
This patch cleans the unused RPC.

Change-Id: Ie49dcea3886b2894426646503b7d40126464299d
Related-Bug: #1415522

commit_message:
[install-guide] keystone-manage pki_setup not necessary for openSUSE/SLES

With Juno it is not longer necessary to manually run keystone-manage
pki_setup on openSUSE/SLES. keystone-manage pki_setup is part of
the post section of the openstack-keystone package.

Change-Id: Id2ba07433dacd29e7b3b4f63171c00d66a53306e
(cherry picked from commit 11c348cdd3ec36f23bbb0ce87c065c14b6a73f52)

apart from device names starting with "ip-" in the "/dev/disk/by-path"
directory.

LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver of nova.virt.libvirt.volume.py is hardcoding
to use /dev/disk/by-path/ip-%s-iscsi-%s-lun-%s (in self._get_host_device,
and disconnect_volume). But when we use h/w iscsi initiators, the
filename starts with pci-<hwaddr>-ip-<targetportal>-iscsi-<target>-lun-<lun id>.
The code is modified so that pci-<hwaddr> files are also searched to
determine if the device exists.

commit_message:
Addressed Jenkins test failures

Modified code to address the following error returned
for undefined name 'iscsi_volume_path'

Coding style errors corrected - indentation contains mixed spaces
and tabs and missing whitespace around arithmetic operator

Change-Id: Id02b3b49c4c900d842146dead44a9632b9146512
Implements: blueprint hw-iscsi-device-name-support

added_lines: import subprocess device_path = self.iscsi_volume_path(iscsi_properties) device_prefix = ("/dev/disk/by-path/%s" % device_path) device_path = self.iscsi_volume_path(iscsi_properties) return ("/dev/disk/by-path/%s" % device_path) def iscsi_volume_path(self,iscsi_properties): device = ("ip-%s-iscsi-%s-lun-%s" % (iscsi_properties['target_portal'], iscsi_properties['target_iqn'], iscsi_properties.get('target_lun', 0))) output = subprocess.check_output(["ls","/dev/disk/by-path"]).split("\n") for device_path in output: if device in device_path: return device_path

commit_message:
[install-guide] do not synchronize Keystone DB on openSUSE/SLES

It is not necessary to manually synchronize the Keystone DB on
openSUSE/SLES because keystone-manage db_sync is part of the
init file.

Change-Id: I54891efe30db0dfc22777845d842956dab10c559
(cherry picked from commit cd4581a1331708b088c35c1a846d23360fc705f7)

commit_message:
[install-guide] Add note about the hourly Keystone cronjob for SUSE

The openstack-keystone package for openSUSE/SLES provides the cronjob
file /etc/cron.hourly/openstack-keystone. It is not necessary to
manually add a cronjob.

Change-Id: Id40f28070380cced861f593772ee9f7cdbecbe14
(cherry picked from commit 5f45d98e88417f135032810be184406645d29818)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/64/155464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para os="debian">The Keystone package already contains a cron job under <filename>/etc/cron.hourly/keystone</filename>, so it is not necessary to manually configure a periodic task that purges expired tokens hourly. You can however have a look at (and eventually customize) the already configured script.</para> <para os="opensuse;sles">The Keystone package already contains a cron job under <filename>/etc/cron.hourly/openstack-keystone</filename>, so it is not necessary to manually configure a periodic task that purges expired tokens hourly. You can however have a look at (and eventually customize) the already configured script.</para> <para os="ubuntu;rhel;centos;fedora">We recommend that you use
deleted_lines: <para>We recommend that you use <screen os="opensuse;sles"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>(crontab -l -u keystone 2>&1 | grep -q token_flush) || \ echo '@hourly /usr/bin/keystone-manage token_flush >/var/log/keystone/keystone-tokenflush.log 2>&1' \ >> /var/spool/cron/tabs/keystone</userinput></screen>

commit_message:
Move autoscaling tests with signals to functional

part of blueprint decouple-nested
Change-Id: I637af12ef9d42dfb9083632c3a3587c9efffe8a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/53/153553/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PublicIp: {value: {get_attr: [random1, value]}} AvailabilityZone: {value: 'not-used11'} PrivateDnsName: {value: 'not-used12'} PublicDnsName: {value: 'not-used13'} PrivateIp: {value: 'not-used14'} class AutoScalingSignalTest(AutoscalingGroupTest): template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Template to create multiple instances.", "Parameters" : {"size": {"Type": "String", "Default": "1"}, "AZ": {"Type": "String", "Default": "nova"}, "image": {"Type": "String"}, "flavor": {"Type": "String"}}, "Resources": { "custom_lb": { "Type": "AWS::EC2::Instance", "Properties": { "ImageId": {"Ref": "image"}, "InstanceType": {"Ref": "flavor"}, "UserData": "foo", "SecurityGroups": [ "sg-1" ], "Tags": [] }, "Metadata": { "IPs": {"Fn::GetAtt": ["JobServerGroup", "InstanceList"]} } }, "JobServerGroup": { "Type" : "AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup", "Properties" : { "AvailabilityZones" : [{"Ref": "AZ"}], "LaunchConfigurationName" : { "Ref" : "JobServerConfig" }, "DesiredCapacity" : {"Ref": "size"}, "MinSize" : "0", "MaxSize" : "20" } }, "JobServerConfig" : { "Type" : "AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration", "Metadata": {"foo": "bar"}, "Properties": { "ImageId" : {"Ref": "image"}, "InstanceType" : {"Ref": "flavor"}, "SecurityGroups" : [ "sg-1" ], "UserData" : "jsconfig data" } }, "ScaleUpPolicy" : { "Type" : "AWS::AutoScaling::ScalingPolicy", "Properties" : { "AdjustmentType" : "ChangeInCapacity", "AutoScalingGroupName" : { "Ref" : "JobServerGroup" }, "Cooldown" : "0", "ScalingAdjustment": "1" } }, "ScaleDownPolicy" : { "Type" : "AWS::AutoScaling::ScalingPolicy", "Properties" : { "AdjustmentType" : "ChangeInCapacity", "AutoScalingGroupName" : { "Ref" : "JobServerGroup" }, "Cooldown" : "0", "ScalingAdjustment" : "-2" } } }, "Outputs": { "InstanceList": {"Value": { "Fn::GetAtt": ["JobServerGroup", "InstanceList"]}} } } ''' lb_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 parameters: ImageId: {type: string} InstanceType: {type: string} SecurityGroups: {type: comma_delimited_list} UserData: {type: string} Tags: {type: comma_delimited_list} resources: outputs: PublicIp: {value: "not-used"} AvailabilityZone: {value: 'not-used1'} PrivateDnsName: {value: 'not-used2'} PublicDnsName: {value: 'not-used3'} PrivateIp: {value: 'not-used4'} ''' def setUp(self): super(AutoScalingSignalTest, self).setUp() self.build_timeout = self.conf.build_timeout self.build_interval = self.conf.build_interval self.files = {'provider.yaml': self.instance_template, 'lb.yaml': self.lb_template} self.env = {'resource_registry': {'resources': {'custom_lb': {'AWS::EC2::Instance': 'lb.yaml'}}, 'AWS::EC2::Instance': 'provider.yaml'}, 'parameters': {'size': 2, 'image': self.conf.image_ref, 'flavor': self.conf.instance_type}} def check_instance_count(self, stack_identifier, expected): stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) inst_list = self._stack_output(stack, 'InstanceList') md = self.client.resources.metadata(stack_identifier, 'custom_lb') actual_md = len(md['IPs'].split(',')) self.assertEqual(actual_md, expected) if actual_md != expected: LOG.warn('check_instance_count exp:%d, meta:%s' % (expected, md['IPs'])) return False actual = len(inst_list.split(',')) if actual != expected: LOG.warn('check_instance_count exp:%d, act:%s' % (expected, inst_list)) return actual == expected def test_scaling_meta_update(self): """Use heatclient to signal the up and down policy. Then confirm that the metadata in the custom_lb is updated each time. """ stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=self.template, files=self.files, environment=self.env) self.assertTrue(test.call_until_true( self.build_timeout, self.build_interval, self.check_instance_count, stack_identifier, 2)) nested_ident = self.assert_resource_is_a_stack(stack_identifier, 'JobServerGroup') # Scale up one, Trigger alarm self.client.resources.signal(stack_identifier, 'ScaleUpPolicy') self._wait_for_stack_status(nested_ident, 'UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(test.call_until_true( self.build_timeout, self.build_interval, self.check_instance_count, stack_identifier, 3)) # Scale down two, Trigger alarm self.client.resources.signal(stack_identifier, 'ScaleDownPolicy') self._wait_for_stack_status(nested_ident, 'UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(test.call_until_true( self.build_timeout, self.build_interval, self.check_instance_count, stack_identifier, 1)) def test_signal_with_policy_update(self): """Prove that an updated policy is used in the next signal.""" stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=self.template, files=self.files, environment=self.env) self.assertTrue(test.call_until_true( self.build_timeout, self.build_interval, self.check_instance_count, stack_identifier, 2)) nested_ident = self.assert_resource_is_a_stack(stack_identifier, 'JobServerGroup') # Scale up one, Trigger alarm self.client.resources.signal(stack_identifier, 'ScaleUpPolicy') self._wait_for_stack_status(nested_ident, 'UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(test.call_until_true( self.build_timeout, self.build_interval, self.check_instance_count, stack_identifier, 3)) # increase the adjustment to "+2" and remove the DesiredCapacity # so we don't go from 3 to 2. new_template = self.template.replace( '"ScalingAdjustment": "1"', '"ScalingAdjustment": "2"').replace( '"DesiredCapacity" : {"Ref": "size"},', '') self.update_stack(stack_identifier, template=new_template, environment=self.env, files=self.files) # Scale up two, Trigger alarm self.client.resources.signal(stack_identifier, 'ScaleUpPolicy') self._wait_for_stack_status(nested_ident, 'UPDATE_COMPLETE') self.assertTrue(test.call_until_true( self.build_timeout, self.build_interval, self.check_instance_count, stack_identifier, 5))

commit_message:
Migrate sync_time into granular deployment taks

* modified shell_hook to take new params to make retries of commands
* remove SyncTime from pre deployment actions for granular deployment
  because it is now implemented as taks

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I43da4b2382ad172fea27ca1abb7544a60fcd08cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/52/151152/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add expire_logs_days = 10 to mysql configuration.

Settings expire_logs_days should be set in /etc/mysql/conf.d/wsrep.cnf to
prevent the logs fill the disk on the controller node.

Change-Id: Id4e50ef8e0b764a53a1aa5f819e562017616f7dd
Closes-Bug: 1420825

Updates heat.rst with 'service-list

Updates heat.rst man page with new command 'heat service-list'

Change-Id: I9f3d6ca5e4c489a65344fb451be4c274e8298129
Closes-bug: #1421299
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/05/155405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: List heat-engines running status :: heat service-list

commit_message:
Add puppet module for Murano

Murano has set of puppet modules developed as part of Fuel Project
and now we are trying to refactor them and publish as standalone
puppet module on StackForge.

Change-Id: I932538ad50d2df19de903d4c8a56f78dea0d7f5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/88/155688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: stackforge/puppet-murano template: - name: merge-check - name: puppet-check-jobs - name: puppet-module-unit-jobs - name: puppet-beaker-jobs - name: puppet-syntax-future

subject: Implement local scripts for all gate tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 16:07:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/78c77902d605c8c16c5ddb6b15e9c5e2765c638d', 'message': 'Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which contains only the host preparation actions for
   an all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which implements a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-build.sh which implements an all-in-one build by default,
   but can be configured to be used in alternative ways through several
   environment variables - the idea here is to make it reusable for
   multi-node purposes. This script calls some of the other scripts when
   the appropriate environment variables are set.
 - gate-check-smoke.sh which implements the running of tempest from
   inside the utility container

Closes-Bug: #1415883
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17

This patch implements the following:
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which contains only the host preparation actions for

   configurations for the AIO deployment

   and other preparation commands for all other scripts

   but can be configured to be used in alternative ways through several
   environment variables - the idea here is to make it reusable for
   multi-node purposes. This script calls some of the other scripts when
   the appropriate environment variables are set.
 - gate-check-smoke.sh which implements the running of tempest from
   inside the utility container

   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - rpc_user_config.yml and conf.d/swift.yml are set as the base
   configurations for the AIO deployment

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2015-02-05 14:28:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/c244ea63bd7583a8c670d4e8bfec249377c0dc11', 'message': '[WIP] Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which contains only the host preparation actions for
   an all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which implements a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-build.sh which implements an all-in-one build by default,
   but can be configured to be used in alternative ways through several
   environment variables - the idea here is to make it reusable for
   multi-node purposes. This script calls some of the other scripts when
   the appropriate environment variables are set.
 - gate-check-smoke.sh which implements the running of tempest from
   inside the utility container
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - rpc_user_config.yml and conf.d/swift.yml are set as the base
   configurations for the AIO deployment

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

'}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2015-02-05 15:21:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/803d110546eef48b65809e9042ccd666b3fa6e54', 'message': '[WIP] Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which contains only the host preparation actions for
   an all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which implements a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-build.sh which implements an all-in-one build by default,
   but can be configured to be used in alternative ways through several
   environment variables - the idea here is to make it reusable for
   multi-node purposes. This script calls some of the other scripts when
   the appropriate environment variables are set.
 - gate-check-smoke.sh which implements the running of tempest from
   inside the utility container
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - rpc_user_config.yml and conf.d/swift.yml are set as the base
   configurations for the AIO deployment

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1415883
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17

'}, {'number': 37, 'created': '2015-02-09 18:05:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/401db1253204326654fbc9241204addfee73081d', 'message': 'Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which runs all host preparation actions for an
   all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which runs a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-commit.sh which runs all actions required for a gate
   commit check, utilising the other scripts where required
 - run-smoke-test.sh which runs tempest from inside the utility container
 - run-playbooks.sh which runs the playbooks
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg,
   etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml and
   etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml are now configurations used for
   the AIO deployment
 - a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1244589 to ensure
   that DHCP checksums are implemented by the host which is required for
   the smoke tests to work

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1415883
Closes-Bug: #1417999
Closes-Bug: #1419807
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17

commit_message:
Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which runs all host preparation actions for an
   all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which runs a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-commit.sh which runs all actions required for a gate
   commit check, utilising the other scripts where required
 - run-smoke-test.sh which runs tempest from inside the utility container
 - run-playbooks.sh which runs the playbooks
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg,
   etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml and
   etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml are now configurations used for
   the AIO deployment
 - a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1244589 to ensure
   that DHCP checksums are implemented by the host which is required for
   the smoke tests to work
 - the removal of the rpc heat templates as they're unusable in their
   current state
 - setting MAX_RETRIES to 0, ensuring that any failures cause an
   immediate commit check failure in the gate - this prevents the
   masking of failures by retry attempts

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1415883
Closes-Bug: #1417999
Closes-Bug: #1419807
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17

added_lines:

(which lxc-ls > /dev/null && which lxc-attach > /dev/null); then echo -e "
ERROR: Please execute this script after a full environment has been deployed.
" exit 1 fi # Check that the utility container exists if ! lxc-ls | grep -q '_utility_container-'; then echo -e "
ERROR: Please execute this script after the deployment of the utility container.
" exit 1 fi # Check that the utility container already has the required tempest script deployed if ! lxc-attach -n $(lxc-ls | grep utility) -- sh -c "ls -al ${SMOKE_SCRIPT_PATH}" > /dev/null 2>&1; then echo -e "
ERROR: Please execute the openstack/tempest.yml playbook prior to this script.
" exit 1 fi # -------------------- Main ------------------------- # Execute the tempest tests lxc-attach -n $(lxc-ls | grep utility) -- sh -c "${SMOKE_SCRIPT_PATH} ${SMOKE_SCRIPT_PARAMETERS}"

commit_message:
Use all dependencies during groups traversal

Using direct predecessors during groups traversal can lead
to wrong ordering in cases where predecessor is skipped.

As example assignment of mongo, one controller and dependent on
controller role, such as cinder, will result in next order:

mongo, cinder
primary-controller

However cinder have dependency on controller, therefore full
path should be taken into account

Closes-bug: #1411660
related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I7530642ec600edaec9d23dba359a7c19e112f200
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/28/154828/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BaseGroupsTraversal(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(BaseGroupsTraversal, self).setUp() self.cluster = mock.Mock() self.cluster.deployment_tasks = yaml.load(self.GROUPS) self.astute = deployment_graph.AstuteGraph(self.cluster) self.nodes = [] def get_node(self, role): """Returns first node if given role.""" return next(n for n in self.nodes if n['role'] == role) class TestParallelGroupsTraversal(BaseGroupsTraversal): GROUPS = """ - id: a type: group role: [a] parameters: strategy: type: parallel - id: b type: group requires: [a] role: [b] parameters: strategy: type: parallel - id: c type: group requires: [b] role: [c] parameters: strategy: type: parallel - id: d type: group requires: [c] role: [d] parameters: strategy: type: parallel """ def test_with_all_nodes_present(self): self.nodes = [{'uid': '3', 'role': 'a'}, {'uid': '1', 'role': 'b'}, {'uid': '2', 'role': 'c'}, {'uid': '4', 'role': 'd'}] self.astute.add_priorities(self.nodes) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('a')['priority'], 100) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('b')['priority'], 200) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('c')['priority'], 300) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('d')['priority'], 400) def test_middle_role_is_not_present(self): self.nodes = [{'uid': '3', 'role': 'a'}, {'uid': '1', 'role': 'b'}, {'uid': '2', 'role': 'd'}] self.astute.add_priorities(self.nodes) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('a')['priority'], 100) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('b')['priority'], 200) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('d')['priority'], 300) def test_two_middle_roles_is_not_present(self): self.nodes = [{'uid': '3', 'role': 'a'}, {'uid': '2', 'role': 'd'}] self.astute.add_priorities(self.nodes) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('a')['priority'], 100) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('d')['priority'], 200) class TestMixedGroupsTraversal(BaseGroupsTraversal): GROUPS = """ - id: a type: group role: [a] parameters: strategy: type: one_by_one - id: b type: group role: [b] parameters: strategy: type: parallel - id: c type: group requires: [a] role: [c] parameters: strategy: type: parallel - id: d type: group requires: [c] role: [d] parameters: strategy: type: parallel - id: e type: group requires: [d, c] role: [e] parameters: strategy: type: one_by_one """ def test_one_by_one_will_be_earlier(self): self.nodes = [{'uid': '3', 'role': 'a'}, {'uid': '1', 'role': 'b'}] self.astute.add_priorities(self.nodes) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('a')['priority'], 100) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('b')['priority'], 200) def test_couple_missed_without_last(self): self.nodes = [{'uid': '3', 'role': 'a'}, {'uid': '1', 'role': 'c'}, {'uid': '4', 'role': 'd'}] self.astute.add_priorities(self.nodes) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('a')['priority'], 100) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('c')['priority'], 200) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('d')['priority'], 300) def test_only_one_by_one(self): self.nodes = [{'uid': '3', 'role': 'a'}, {'uid': '1', 'role': 'e'}] self.astute.add_priorities(self.nodes) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('a')['priority'], 100) self.assertEqual(self.get_node('e')['priority'], 200)

commit_message:
Refactoring of DeletionTask

- DeletionTask now accepts explicit 'nodes' parameter for nodes to be removed
- Cleaned up unnecessary DB calls
- Added tests

Implements blueprint node-removal-task
Closes-Bug: #1415062

Change-Id: I85b22d1e79a8f9fbe3f224a5d5076fb3ce045e5b

commit_message:
Stop console at first if console is enabled when destroy node

Previously, when node was deleted with console enabled,
the console process was not stopped.
Now stop console at first, then delete the node.

Closes-Bug: #1418804
Change-Id: Ia994b20c42df0a1f2882889a1be6dd4f426ee569

subject: Refactoring for export functions in Target object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-17 03:41:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/79bee432b20665a4ce99e750ab97c433d4b9a884', 'message': 'Refactoring for export functions in Target object

Currently, export functions such as create_export() are implemented
in individual Target code, but most of them are same and these are
common features in each target.
This patch moves these methods to parent ISCSITarget class to
commonalize and each Target simply inherit these methods from parent
class. As a result of this change, LioAdm can inherit ISCSITarget
class directly instead of inheriting TgtAdm class.
This simplifies dependency of targets and improves maintainability.

By refactoring these methods, this patch also fixes following issues.

(a) Fix bug #1410566
After transitioning to the new driver and target model, iscsi_targets
is not added to the table during create_export() phase.
However, remove_export() in LIO Target is still reffering empty
iscsi_targets table. This causes NotFound exception and remove_export()
skips to do remove_iscsi_target().
As a result, iscsi target is not removed and the target continues to
grab the volume(logical volume) as an in-use status.
This patch fix the problem.

(b) Re-export a volume with CHAP
Current Tgt Target recreate iscsi target without CHAP during
ensure_export() even if the volume is exported with CHAP previously.
This patch changes this bahaviour to recreate iscsi target using
previous CHAP which is stored in volume file on state_path dir.

(c) Raise correct exception if deleting of iSCSI target is failed
terminate_connection in LIO target raises ISCSITargetAttachFailed
if deleting of iSCSI target is failed.
This should be raised ISCSITargetDetachFailed.

(d) Delete _ensure_iscsi_targets()
This methods is dead code in tgt.py after transitioning.

Closes-Bug: 1410566
Change-Id: Iea3d94e35a4ced4dafc1b61e2df6b075cf200577
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-19 17:32:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/b397e3bef8e392e91ca12feb3b99cf0fd46ae1bd', 'message': 'Refactoring for export functions in Target object

Currently, export functions such as create_export() are implemented
in individual Target code, but most of them are same and these are
common features in each target.
This patch moves these methods to parent ISCSITarget class to
commonalize and each Target simply inherit these methods from parent
class. As a result of this change, LioAdm can inherit ISCSITarget
class directly instead of inheriting TgtAdm class.
This simplifies dependency of targets and improves maintainability.

By refactoring these methods, this patch also fixes following issues.

(a) Fix bug #1410566
After transitioning to the new driver and target model, iscsi_targets
is not added to the table during create_export() phase.
However, remove_export() in LIO Target is still reffering empty
iscsi_targets table. This causes NotFound exception and remove_export()
skips to do remove_iscsi_target().
As a result, iscsi target is not removed and the target continues to
grab the volume(logical volume) as an in-use status.
This patch fix the problem.

(b) Re-export a volume with CHAP
Current Tgt Target recreate iscsi target without CHAP during
ensure_export() even if the volume is exported with CHAP previously.
This patch changes this bahaviour to recreate iscsi target using
previous CHAP which is stored in volume file on state_path dir.

(c) Raise correct exception if deleting of iSCSI target is failed
terminate_connection in LIO target raises ISCSITargetAttachFailed
if deleting of iSCSI target is failed.
This should be raised ISCSITargetDetachFailed.

(d) Delete _ensure_iscsi_targets()
This methods is dead code in tgt.py after transitioning.

Closes-Bug: 1410566
Change-Id: Iea3d94e35a4ced4dafc1b61e2df6b075cf200577

commit_message:
Refactoring for export functions in Target object

Currently, export functions such as create_export() are implemented
in individual Target code, but most of them are same and these are
common features in each target.
This patch moves these methods to parent ISCSITarget class to
commonalize and each Target simply inherit these methods from parent
class. As a result of this change, LioAdm can inherit ISCSITarget
class directly instead of inheriting TgtAdm class.
This simplifies dependency of targets and improves maintainability.

By refactoring these methods, this patch also fixes following issues.

(a) Fix bug #1410566
After transitioning to the new driver and target model, iscsi_targets
is not added to the table during create_export() phase.
However, remove_export() in LIO Target is still reffering empty
iscsi_targets table. This causes NotFound exception and remove_export()
skips to do remove_iscsi_target().
As a result, iscsi target is not removed and the target continues to
grab the volume(logical volume) as an in-use status.
This patch fix the problem.

(b) Re-export a volume with CHAP
Current Tgt Target recreate iscsi target without CHAP during
ensure_export() even if the volume is exported with CHAP previously.
This patch changes this bahaviour to recreate iscsi target using
previous CHAP which is stored in volume file on state_path dir.

Closes-Bug: 1410566
Change-Id: Iea3d94e35a4ced4dafc1b61e2df6b075cf200577
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/38/148038/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import abc from cinder.i18n import _, _LI, _LW, _LEfrom cinder.volume import utils as vutils self.volumes_dir = self.configuration.safe_get('volumes_dir') def create_export(self, context, volume, volume_path): """Creates an export for a logical volume.""" # 'iscsi_name': 'iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-00000001' iscsi_name = "%s%s" % (self.configuration.iscsi_target_prefix, volume['name']) iscsi_target, lun = self._get_target_and_lun(context, volume) # Verify we haven't setup a CHAP creds file already # if DNE no big deal, we'll just create it chap_auth = self._get_target_chap_auth(context, iscsi_name) if not chap_auth: chap_auth = (vutils.generate_username(), vutils.generate_password()) # NOTE(jdg): For TgtAdm case iscsi_name is the ONLY param we need # should clean this all up at some point in the future tid = self.create_iscsi_target(iscsi_name, iscsi_target, 0, volume_path, chap_auth) data = {} data['location'] = self._iscsi_location( self.configuration.iscsi_ip_address, tid, iscsi_name, lun) LOG.debug('Set provider_location to: %s', data['location']) data['auth'] = self._iscsi_authentication( 'CHAP', *chap_auth) return data def remove_export(self, context, volume): try: iscsi_target = self._get_iscsi_target(context, volume['id']) except exception.NotFound: LOG.info(_LI("Skipping remove_export. No iscsi_target " "provisioned for volume: %s"), volume['id']) return try: # NOTE: provider_location may be unset if the volume hasn't # been exported location = volume['provider_location'].split(' ') iqn = location[1] # ietadm show will exit with an error # this export has already been removed self.show_target(iscsi_target, iqn=iqn) except Exception: LOG.info(_LI("Skipping remove_export. No iscsi_target " "is presently exported for volume: %s"), volume['id']) return # NOTE: For TgtAdm case volume['id'] is the ONLY param we need self.remove_iscsi_target(iscsi_target, 0, volume['id'], volume['name']) def ensure_export(self, context, volume, volume_path): """Recreates an export for a logical volume.""" iscsi_name = "%s%s" % (self.configuration.iscsi_target_prefix, volume['name']) # Verify we haven't setup a CHAP creds file already # if DNE no big deal, we'll just create it chap_auth = self._get_target_chap_auth(context, iscsi_name) if not chap_auth: LOG.info(_LI("Skipping ensure_export. No iscsi_target " "provision for volume: %s"), volume['id']) iscsi_target, lun = self._get_target_and_lun(context, volume) self.create_iscsi_target( iscsi_name, iscsi_target, lun, volume_path, chap_auth, check_exit_code=False, old_name=None) def terminate_connection(self, volume, connector, **kwargs): pass def _iscsi_location(self, ip, target, iqn, lun=None): return "%s:%s,%s %s %s" % (ip, self.configuration.iscsi_port, target, iqn, lun) def show_target(self, iscsi_target, iqn, **kwargs): if iqn is None: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue( err=_('valid iqn needed for show_target')) tid = self._get_target(iqn) if tid is None: raise exception.NotFound() @abc.abstractmethod def _get_target_and_lun(self, context, volume): """Get iscsi target and lun.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def _get_target_chap_auth(self, context, iscsi_name): pass @abc.abstractmethod def create_iscsi_target(self, name, tid, lun, path, chap_auth, **kwargs): pass @abc.abstractmethod def remove_iscsi_target(self, tid, lun, vol_id, vol_name, **kwargs): pass @abc.abstractmethod def _get_iscsi_target(context, vol_id): pass
deleted_lines: from cinder.i18n import _, _LW, _LE def _get_target_chap_auth(self, volume_id): """Get the current chap auth username and password.""" return None

commit_message:
Add resource quota checks for clusters

Resources for checks:
* CPU
* RAM
* instances
* floating ips
* volumes
* volume storage capacity
* security groups
* security group rules

Closes-bug: #1174612

Change-Id: Iecef1acc506a75d041ed5329b102d9891aad6962
